source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Covers overseas transport and accommodation expenses due to trip cancellation. See Section 1 of the table.

COVID-19 related cancellation is covered if it results in serious sickness (for Section 1). Must fulfill vaccination/testing requirements of destination/carrier. Event must occur after policy purchase and within 30 days before departure (unless accidental). Policy must be bought >=3 days before departure (unless accidental).
Covers costs incurred due to postponing your trip. See Section 2 of the table.

base_limits.type: Limit for extra expenses to return to Singapore (Per insured person)

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Covers overseas transport and accommodation expenses due to trip shortening. See Section 3 of the table.
COVID-19 related shortening is covered. Must fulfill vaccination/testing requirements of destination/carrier. Event must occur after policy purchase.

base_limits.type: Limit for accommodation expenses per room per night (Per insured person)

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Covers costs due to trip disruption. See Section 4 of the table.

base_limits.basis: For every six hours of delay
For every six hours of delay

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Coverage for travel delay not caused by you. See Section 5 of the table.
Payable if the public transport is delayed for more than six hours in a row and the delay is not caused by you.
Covers costs due to missed connections. See Section 6 of the table.
Covers costs if denied boarding due to overbooking. See Section 7 of the table.
Covers losses if the travel agency becomes insolvent. See Section 8 of the table.

base_limits.basis: For every six hours of delay
For every six hours of delay

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Covers costs due to baggage delay. See Section 9 of the table.

coverages.coverage_name: Loss or damage of baggage and personal belongings

base_limits.type: Limit for watches, jewellery or valuables in total (Per insured person)
Limit for other items (for each item, set or pair) (Per insured person)

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Covers loss or damage to baggage and personal belongings. See Section 10 of the table.
Covers loss of cash. See Section 11 of the table.

base_limits.type: Limit for accommodation expenses per room per night (Per insured person)

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Covers costs to replace lost travel documents and related accommodation expenses. See Section 12 of the table.

coverage_categories.category_name: Personal Accident and Medical Expenses Benefits

base_limits.type: Adult 70 years old or over (Per insured person)
Adult under 70 years old (Per insured person)

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Provides compensation based on the Scale of Compensation (e.g., 100% for Accidental death, Permanent total disability, Losing two or more limbs, Losing sight in both eyes; 50% for Losing one limb, Losing sight in one eye, Losing speech, Losing hearing). Total compensation cannot exceed the maximum benefit limit. Public transport double cover is not available for Classic plan. See Section 13 of the table.

base_limits.type: Adult 70 years old or over (Per insured person, combined for sections 14, 18 and 19)
Adult under 70 years old (Per insured person)
Limit for medical aids and equipment (Per insured person)

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Covers medical expenses incurred overseas, including treatment by a Chinese medicine practitioner or a chiropractor (subject to policy conditions and sub-limits per visit). See Section 14 of the table.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 2, Benefit 5 & Page 7, Section 14 & Page 10, Note 4

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: COVID-19 related medical expenses overseas are covered, subject to eligibility requirements (vaccination/testing) and policy conditions.
Standard plans do not cover pre-existing medical conditions.

base_limits.type: Overall section limit - Adult 70 years old or over (Per insured person)
Overall section limit - Adult under 70 years old (Per insured person)
Overall section limit - Child (Per insured person)
Limit for medical aids and equipment (Per insured person)

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Covers medical expenses incurred in Singapore after returning from the trip. See Section 15 of the table.
COVID-19 cover applies to sections 1 to 25 *except* section 15 (Medical expenses in Singapore).
Standard plans do not cover pre-existing medical conditions.

coverages.coverage_name: Treatment by a Chinese medicine practitioner or a chiropractor

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Covers treatment by a registered Chinese medicine practitioner or chiropractor incurred during the trip. Refer to policy conditions for requirements and sub-limit per visit. See Section 16 of the table.
source_specific_details.source_location: Page 2, Benefit 5 & Page 8, Section 16 & Page 10, Note 4

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Provides a daily cash benefit for each day of hospitalisation overseas. See Section 17 of the table.

base_limits.type: Adult 70 years old or over (Per insured person)
Adult under 70 years old (Per insured person)

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Covers expenses for emergency medical evacuation. For adults 70+, this is part of the combined limit with Section 14 & 19. See Section 18 of the table.
Included as a post-departure benefit if policy purchased after departure.

base_limits.type: Adult 70 years old or over (Per insured person)
Adult under 70 years old (Per insured person)

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Covers expenses for repatriation (sending you home). For adults 70+, this is part of the combined limit with Section 14 & 18. See Section 19 of the table.

base_limits.type: Limit for accommodation expenses per room per night (Per insured person)

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Covers travel and accommodation expenses for one relative or friend to visit if you are hospitalised overseas. See Section 20 of the table.
Provides a benefit if you are kidnapped or held hostage during your trip. See Section 21 of the table.
Covers emergency phone call charges incurred due to an insured event. See Section 22 of the table.

base_limits.type: Limit per item (for each item, set or pair) (Per insured person)

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Covers loss or damage to home contents due to burglary while your home is unoccupied during your trip. See Section 23 of the table.
Covers your legal liability for accidentally injuring someone or damaging their property during your trip. See Section 24 of the table.
Covers the insurance excess you have to pay if your rental vehicle is damaged or stolen. See Section 25 of the table.

base_limits.type: Adult 70 years old or over (Per insured person)
Adult under 70 years old (Per insured person)

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Provides cover for losses arising from acts of terrorism, applying the specified limits to benefits under sections 1 to 25. See Section 26 of the table.

base_limits.limit: See limits of respective sections that apply

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Provides cover related to COVID-19 for benefits under sections 1 to 25 (except section 15 - Medical expenses in Singapore), subject to the limits of those sections. See Section 27 of the table.

Eligibility requires fulfilling all vaccination, pre-departure tests and post-arrival tests requirements imposed by the destination country or transport operator. Must also fulfil conditions in the relevant section (e.g., COVID-19 must result in serious sickness for Section 1 cancellation).

For trip cancellation due to COVID-19, the event must occur after policy purchase and within 30 days before departure (unless accidental). Policy must be bought >=3 days before departure (unless accidental). For trip shortening, event must occur after policy purchase.

base_limits.limit: See limits of respective sections that apply

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Allows purchase after departure from Singapore (Per-trip plans only). Provides cover under sections 3 to 27 (except section 8 - Travel agency insolvency), subject to the limits of those sections. See Section 28 of the table.
Purchase must be within one day after departing Singapore. Provides post-departure benefits like medical expenses overseas and emergency medical evacuation.
Excludes claims arising from transport taken before purchase, claims resulting from any known event, and losses that occurred before policy purchase.

Coverage provided for participation in leisure adventurous activities including water (scuba diving, paddleboarding, rafting), winter (skiing, snowboarding), air (bungee, skydiving, paragliding), and other outdoor activities (hiking, trekking, motorcycling, hot air balloon).

Activity must be commonly available, done for leisure, comply with safety procedures/rules, use licensed guides/instructors if available, and not be excluded under general exclusions. Excludes extreme sports involving speed, height, danger, high exertion, specialized gear, or stunts.

Scuba diving covered if holding PADI (or similar) certification diving with a certified buddy, or diving with a qualified instructor. Max depth as per certification or 30 metres, whichever is shallower.
Trekking covered if below 4,000 metres, in a place open to the public without restriction, or organised by recognised operator/guide, and safety equipment/procedures are followed.

Family cover provides coverage for 1 or 2 adults (spouses/partners, >=16 yrs, parent/legal guardian) and any number of their children (<21 yrs, biological/legally adopted/ward). All must be insured under the same policy. For single trip plans, adults and children must travel together.
Family total is the maximum amount payable per benefit section for the entire family during one trip. Each insured person is also subject to the maximum benefit per insured person limit.

Coverage period automatically extended at no extra cost for the first 14 days while overseas if unable to return before policy expiry due to delay of public transport (not caused by you) or hospitalisation advised by a medical practitioner.
